messages.message:
Hi team, when I try to add a python dependency with `make update requirements`, I get the following error
```Makefile:39: warning: overriding commands for target `update-requirements'
/Users/adamlipson/Documents/codebase/instabase/tools/devtools/code-dependencies/../../../shared-utils/build-utils/shared/build-python.mk:370: warning: ignoring old commands for target `update-requirements'
cd /Users/adamlipson/Documents/codebase/instabase/tools/devtools/code-dependencies/python && pip-compile requirements.base.in (http://requirements.base.in) requirements.python37.in (http://requirements.python37.in) --output-file=requirements_py37.txt
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/adamlipson/Documents/codebase/instabase/venv3/bin/pip-compile", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(cli())
  File "/Users/adamlipson/Documents/codebase/instabase/venv3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1128, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/Users/adamlipson/Documents/codebase/instabase/venv3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1053, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "/Users/adamlipson/Documents/codebase/instabase/venv3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1395, in invoke
    return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params)
  File "/Users/adamlipson/Documents/codebase/instabase/venv3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 754, in invoke
    return __callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/Users/adamlipson/Documents/codebase/instabase/venv3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/decorators.py", line 26, in new_func
    return f(get_current_context(), *args, **kwargs)
  File "/Users/adamlipson/Documents/codebase/instabase/venv3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/piptools/scripts/compile.py", line 332, in cli
    repository = PyPIRepository(pip_args, cache_dir=cache_dir)
  File "/Users/adamlipson/Documents/codebase/instabase/venv3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/piptools/repositories/pypi.py", line 106, in __init__
    self._setup_logging()
  File "/Users/adamlipson/Documents/codebase/instabase/venv3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/piptools/repositories/pypi.py", line 464, in _setup_logging
    assert isinstance(handler, logging.StreamHandler)
AssertionError
make: *** [update-requirements] Error 1```
This is resolved when I upgrade my pip-tools from 6.2.0 to 6.8.0, but that results in some format diffs for existing dependencies in the resulting `requirements.txt` file (replacing `_` with `-` and reformatting github links). Should pip-tools 6.2.0 be able to compile requirements.in (http://requirements.in)?
yeah, i think only 6.2.0 gives you the existing format, can you try to downgrade back to that?
I've tried that but I can't build without errors on 6.2.0. Is that an issue we've seen before?
sry nope, not familiar with the error offhand
